name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Career Readiness for Future Professionals
base_name: Student Taught Courses (StuCo): Career Readiness for Future Professionals
long_desc: In this class, youll develop a foundation of the career readiness skills needed to find and succeed in your future career Youll identify and develop your career and professional goals, learn to write a strong resume and cover letter, and utilize professional communication and networking skills. Additionally, youll develop an understanding of how different types of summersemester experiences internships, research, campus jobs, etc. can be valuable, and develop the interviewing skills needed to obtain those experiences. This course isnt specific to any one major or career field, but the instructor hopes to work together with each student to help you apply these concepts to your own career path.

custom_fields.goals: After completing this course, students will hopefully achieve the learning objectives listed above.
custom_fields.key_topics:
Learning objectives:
Identify career and professional goals; write a strong resume and cover letter; utilize professional communication and networking skills; understand how different types of summer/semester experiences (internships, research, campus jobs, etc.) can be valuable; utilize effective interviewing skills.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: No prerequisite knowledge about career readiness is required to be successful in this course. The instructor will accommodate each student's knowledge and experience level.
custom_fields.assessment_structure:

custom_fields.relevance: This course is relevant to any CMU student, but especially targeted towards freshmen and sophomores from all departments. Many freshmen and sophomores do not yet possess career readiness skills but are starting to think about research, internships, etc. The goal of this course is to help these students to develop career readiness skills, which they can then hopefully use to obtain experiences that are of interest to them.
custom_fields.learning_resources: The Career Launch Canvas modules, which much of this course is based off of, are available to all students. Additionally, this course will use resources that are free to CMU students, like CMUniverse, Handshake, and Management Consulted, as well as online resources that are available to everyone, like HackerRank, LeetCode, and LinkedIn.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students will be expected to complete brief homework assignments in between many classes.
